content.prompt: An advertisement airs on television attacking a candidate running for office. The advertisement was produced and distributed by a group that was not affiliated with nor funded by any political campaign. Which of the following statements explains why this expenditure is not prohibited by the Bipartisan Campaign Reform Act of 2002 ?

choices.label: The press can freely criticize elected officials in their publications.
Political spending by groups not directly affiliated with a campaign is a form of protected speech.
The press can protect the confidentiality of their sources with regard to campaign funding violations.
Restrictions on individual contributions to political campaigns violate the First Amendment.
